D. Five-Year Accident History 
No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.
 
E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 
It is the policy of Midwest Ice Cream to conduct business in a manner that is safe to the employees, the community, and the environment. The Company's officers, managers and supervisors are accountable to carry out the policies of Midwest Ice Cream relevant to the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials.

Midwest Ice Cream has made a determined effort to develop a plan to prevent releases of extremely hazardous substances. In the development of this plan, Midwest Ice Cream has used numerous resources both inside and outside the Belvidere facility. EPA's Risk Management Program and OSHA's Process Safety Management Program provided the guidelines in the development of the Prevention Plan.

In the event of an accidental release, Midwest Ice Cream has developed and implemented an Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Plan provides guidance for identifying and reporting accidental releases. The Emergency Action Plan includes an incident command system for decision-making authority for each stage of an accidental release. The facility has coordinated with public responders and local emergency services to enhance public safety.

Midwest Ice Cream Company processes ice cream products. 

Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation.
